content.html:
Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

For questions 1–8, solve each system of equations to determine if there is one solution, no solution, or infinitely many solutions.


1. \( \begin {cases} 5x − 3y = 7\\ x − 0.6y = 1.4 \end{cases} \)

Correct! infinitely many solutions

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.6.1. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is infinitely many solutions. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

2. \( \begin {cases} −x+2y=−1\\ 5x−10y=6 \end{cases} \)

Correct! no solution

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.6.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is no solution. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

3. \( \begin {cases} 7x+6y=2\\ −28x−24y=−8 \end{cases} \)

Correct! infinitely many solutions

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.6.1. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is infinitely many solutions. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

4. \( \begin {cases} −0.2x + 0.4y = 0.6\\ x−2y=−3 \end{cases} \)

Correct! infinitely many solutions

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.6.1 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is infinitely many solutions. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

5. \( \begin {cases} −0.1x + 0.2y = 0.6\\ 5x−10y=1 \end{cases} \)

Correct! no solution

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.6.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is no solution. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

6. \( \begin {cases} 3x+6y=11\\ 2x+4y=9 \end{cases} \)

Correct! no solution

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.6.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is no solution. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

7. \( \begin {cases} −x+2y=4\\ 2x−4y=1 \end{cases} \)

Correct! no solution

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.6.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is no solution. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

8. \( \begin {cases} 3x−2y=5\\ −9x+6y=−15 \end{cases} \)

Correct! infinitely many solutions

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.6.1 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is infinitely many solutions. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

9. Which system of equations has infinitely many solutions?

Correct! \(-4x + 3y = 12\) and \(-8x + 6y = 24\)

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 2.6.3 and 2.6.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(-4x + 3y = 12\) and \(-8x + 6y = 24\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

10. Which system of equations has no solution?

Multiple choice:

Correct! \(3x + 7y = 15\) and \(3x + 7y = 40\)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activities 2.6.3 and 2.6.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(3x + 7y = 15\) and \(3x + 7y = 40\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?
